Generate UUIDs

Source: R/uuid.R
uuid.Rd

Generate UUIDs using the uuid package. This is simply a thin wrapper around uuid::UUIDgenerate that matches the interface in the rest of the ids package.

uuid(n = 1, drop_hyphens = FALSE, use_time = NA)

Arguments

n

number of ids to return. If NULL, it instead returns the generating function
drop_hyphens

Drop the hyphens from the UUID?
use_time

Passed through to UUIDgenerate as use.time.

Author

Rich FitzJohn

Examples

# Generate one id
uuid()

#> [1] "236caa23-2179-4982-a674-eb660f6d666c"

# Or a bunch
uuid(10)

#>  [1] "fdf29dfc-955f-4ee2-8e79-1e4d05227456"
#>  [2] "79808e73-3364-4198-83fc-93007ad42375"
#>  [3] "88f69d84-21f7-4d1e-8e63-67b2c579e227"
#>  [4] "c19f62ad-af12-4d5f-8f47-c36ad40c5d66"
#>  [5] "d3f10091-43cd-4e0a-a1a4-d1b9f3af5191"
#>  [6] "a43b7045-8bbd-411c-aa81-10fb820cffb9"
#>  [7] "97f9e84e-0399-4648-8af9-d6acda0db98f"
#>  [8] "0af05c15-f1ba-4557-a07c-aa528e3aba1a"
#>  [9] "c809b5e3-d997-4628-8d2d-b8ae16ef7c75"
#> [10] "021c1627-61c2-478d-a456-4ec82b43e434"

# More in the style of random_id()
uuid(drop_hyphens = TRUE)

#> [1] "5366ef18586a4a68a4eca6f054196e5a"
